whaleAnimation.pumpInfoCard: All whales dive underwater to feed and return to the surface to breathe. At the surface, they release buoyant fecal plumes that are rich in nutrients that phytoplankton - contribute at least 50 percent of all oxygen to atmosphere, and capture about 37 billion metric tons of CO2 - need to grow
whaleAnimation.deadInfoCard: When large marine vertebrates die, their carcasses sink to the seafloor. There, the carbon inside their carcass can suport deep-sea ecosystems and be incorporated into marine sediments
